com.github.i49.hibiscus.facets

Interface Facet<V extends JsonValue>

  • Type Parameters:
    V - the type of JsonValue to which this facet will be applied.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AssertionFacet, EnumerationFacet, FormatFacet, LengthFacet, MaxLengthFacet, MaxNumberFacet, MinLengthFacet, MinNumberFacet, PatternFacet, UniqueItemFacet

    public interface Facet<V extends JsonValue>
    Common interface to be implemented by all facet classes.

    A facet is a single defining aspect of a value space of types. Each of built-in types in schema for JSON just provides default value space of its own. By using facet, you can restrict the value spaces of these types as necessary.

    For example, you can express type restrictions listed below.

    • valid range of numeric values, such as lower or upper threshold of the range.
    • the length of values, such as length of string.
    • list of values to be considered as valid.
    • predefined format of values.
    • regular expression that valid values must match.

    This package provides various kinds of facet implementations, and all these classes implement this Facet interface. Each facet in this package can be applied to a value in JSON document and when it detects the value is out of valid value space, it will report one or more corresponding problems. All problems to be reported by the facets are defined in com.github.i49.hibiscus.problems package.

    The table shown below lists all facets defined in this package.

    The list of facets
    No. Facet Name Description Applicable Types Implemented By Problem Reported
    1 length allows only values of a specific length. array(), string() LengthFacet ArrayLengthProblem, StringLengthProblem
    2 maxLength restricts the upper bound of value length. array(), string() MaxLengthFacet ArrayTooLongProblem, StringTooLongProblem
    3 minLength restricts the lower bound of value length. array(), string() MinLengthFacet ArrayTooShortProblem, StringTooShortProblem
    4 maxInclusive restricts the upper bound of numeric range. integer(), number() MaxNumberFacet InclusiveUpperBoundProblem
    5 maxExclusive same as maxInclusive while the boundary is excluded from the valid range. integer(), number() MaxNumberFacet ExclusiveUpperBoundProblem
    6 minInclusive restricts the lower bound of numeric range. integer(), number() MinNumberFacet InclusiveLowerBoundProblem
    7 minExclusive same as minInclusive while the boundary is excluded from the valid range. integer(), number() MinNumberFacet ExclusiveLowerBoundProblem
    8 pattern restricts string values by a regular expression. string() PatternFacet StringPatternProblem
    9 unique enforces each element in array to be unique. array() UniqueItemFacet ArrayDuplicateItemProblem
    10 enumeration restricts the value space to a set of distinct values. boolean(), integer(), number(), string() EnumerationFacet NoSuchEnumeratorProblem
    11 assertion adds arbitrary assertions on the type. all but nil() AssertionFacet AssertionFailureProblem
    12 format specifies predefined format of the type. string() FormatFacet InvalidFormatProblem

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void apply(V value, List<Problem> problems)
      Applies this facet to a value in JSON document and when the value is out of valid value space, it reports one or more corresponding problems.

    • Method Detail

      • apply

        void apply(V value,
           List<Problem> problems)
        Applies this facet to a value in JSON document and when the value is out of valid value space, it reports one or more corresponding problems.
        Parameters:
        value - JsonValue in JSON document to be validated.
        problems - the list of problems to which new problems found by this facet will be added.
